Donate WHO WE ARE Between our dedicated staff and extraordinary volunteers, we have centuries of experience building, teaching and cultivating local circular economies. Together, we‚Äôre working to change the way we, as a city, think about our food and our environment. OUR MISSION WHAT WE DO Our mission is to cultivate local circular economies. ‚Äã We envision a paradigm shift in production, consumption and waste driven at the local level, generating equity and economic opportunity for all residents. ‚Äã What is a Circular Economy? ‚Äã At the facility scale, a circular economy can be described as conventional waste streams from one process being re-purposed as inputs for another, creating a circular, closed-loop model of material reuse. ‚Äã At the local scale, it can be described as a collaborative economic practice sustained by local circulation of materials, nutrients, knowledge, and money. It‚Äôs empowered by transparency, diversity, and inclusion. Read more here . We equip people and businesses with the tools to live more sustainably through community-driven, hands-on programs and innovative research projects. ‚Äã History ‚Äã Plant Chicago was established in 2011 as the anchor for the project known as The Plant , a collaborative community of food businesses on the southwest side of Chicago. For 8 years, Plant Chicago supported the ever evolving project and brought tangible benefits to the surrounding community. ‚Äã We are now operating out of a former firehouse, which we are renovating into a center for circular economy programming in the Back of the Yards neighborhood on the southwest side of Chicago. More on Plant Chicago's history can be found here . History STAFF Jonathan Pereira Executive Director Narcisse Robles Circular Economy Communications Coordinator STAFF Kiara Balleza Program Associate Karen Canales Salas Development and Communications Manager Litzy Estrada Aquaponics and Hydroponics Associate Andrea X. Kim Anderson, co-founder of Plant City Providence, joins Joe Paolino In The Arena ‚Äì Paolino Properties About Portfolio Listings Press About Portfolio Listings Partnerships Press Contact Login In the Press 01.26.20 Kim Anderson, co-founder of Plant City Providence, joins Joe Paolino In The Arena Kim Anderson, co-founder of the groundbreaking all plant-based food hall, Plant City Providence (334 S. Water Street), joined Joe Paolino Jr. to discuss how plant-based diets have changed throughout the years, how Plant City has succeeded beyond expectations in Providence and how even just one plant-based establishment can make for a dramatic impact in addressing climate change, on the show that aired January 26th, 2020, at 7 AM, on ABC6 Share This Article Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Facebook Click to share on X (Opens in new window) X Click to share on LinkedIn (Opens in new window) LinkedIn Previous Post All Posts Next Post Related Posts What‚Äôs Next for the Superman Building? THE SEARCH IS ON FOR THE GOLDEN TRAIN The Golden Train will take you all over our historic downtown into some incredible places. If you are the lucky one to find it, treasure will be yours! Full details here Ten trains are hidden throughout downtown Plant City as part of this outdoor scavenger hunt. Bring your friends, family, train enthusiasts and history buffs to the Willaford Railroad Museum for your free map. Then follow the clues to track down all of #HenrysHiddenTrains! All aboard to help Henry find his lost trains in downtown Plant City! Learn More! We are proud to share that Historic Plant City Main Street has once again achieved the honor of being a Main Street America Accredited program‚Äîthe highest level of recognition within the national Main Street movement. Accredited status is awarded to programs that demonstrate a steadfast commitment to excellence in revitalizing their historic downtowns. It reflects a proven track record of planning, implementing, and measuring impactful results that align with the Main Street Approach, a time-tested framework for community transformation. To receive this top-tier designation, programs must meet a comprehensive set of baseline requirements and show continued success across all six Accreditation Standards, including economic vitality, design, promotion, organization, equity, and preservation. This recognition is a direct reflection of the hard work and dedication of our staff, board, volunteers, downtown businesses, community partners, and supporters. Together, we are preserving Plant City's heritage, supporting local enterprise, and building a vibrant, resilient future. We are honored to be part of a powerful national network that is transforming communities from the inside out. Learn more about the mission of Main Street America at www.mainstreet.org Thank you for believing in the heart of Plant City. Thank you for being part of the story. Complaints & Compliments Anonymously submit a complaint or compliment using the message box below. Message * Thank you! Historic Plant City Main Street is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to the revitalization and preservation of our charming downtown through community-driven economic development, cultural enrichment, and historic preservation. As an accredited Main Street America‚Ñ¢ program, we are committed to fostering a vibrant, welcoming destination where residents and visitors alike can experience the heart and soul of Plant City. Through signature events like Oktoberfest, Last Friday, and the inaugural Strawberry Drop, we celebrate our heritage while creating fresh opportunities for local businesses, artists, and families to thrive. At the core of our mission is a deep respect for history and a bold vision for the future‚Äîbringing our downtown into tomorrow without losing her yesterday. Historic Plant City Main Street is a 501(c)3 Nonprofit Organization

Our Mission & Story | About Us | Plant City 0 Skip to Content Order Plant City Reservations Plant City Menu SƒíZN Dinner Menu Open Menu Close Menu Order Plant City Reservations Plant City Menu SƒíZN Dinner Menu Open Menu Close Menu Order Plant City Reservations Plant City Menu SƒíZN Dinner Menu Our Story The world‚Äôs first plant-based food hall & marketplace Plant City is the world‚Äôs first plant-based vegan food hall & marketplace. All of Plant City‚Äôs restaurants and bars are serve 100% plant-based vegan cuisine. Plant City‚Äôs first location is in downtown Providence, known as the Creative Capital. Driven By Purpose We believe that a plant-based diet is the way of the future. A plant-based lifestyle is better for animals, people, and the planet. At Plant City we make it beautiful, delicious, enjoyable and easy for people to incorporate plant-based options into their lives. Our hope is that plant-based eating becomes the norm instead of the exception, and want to help create that future. Sign up for updates. Email Address Sign Up Thank you for signing up. You‚Äôve been subscribed to our newsletter and will receive future update emails.
